newsitem.title: UK: IEA says OECD stocks shortfall halved in August.
newsitem.headline: IEA says OECD stocks shortfall halved in August.

text.p: The shortfall in commercial oil stocks held in OECD nations was reduced in August but distillate stocks in the U.S. and Europe remained sharply below year-ago levels, the International Energy Agency (IEA) said on Tuesday.

An August stockbuild of 900,000 bpd, compared with a 1.3 million bpd draw last year, reduced the shortfall in OECD industry stocks from 128 million barrels at end-July to 62 million barrels, the IEA said.
It said almost all the stocks shortfall at the end of August was in North America.
"In contrast to the U.S., total European stocks at the end of August were only slightly below last year's level, while they were essentially unchanged in the Pacific," said the agency.
Distillate stocks were lower in Europe and the U.S. remained lower versus last year.

"Whereas distillate stocks in the Pacific were marginally above the previous year's level for the first time in more than a year, they were 26 million barrels (10 percent) lower in Europe and 23 million barrels (11 percent) lower in North America," said the IEA.
"By contrast crude oil and gasoline stocks in both Europe and North America were above last year's levels."
